meanings.definition: A sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information.
meanings.sent1: She asked many questions during the class.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always encourages students to ask questions.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat had so many questions about the new toy.
meanings.sent4: His questions were like keys unlocking hidden knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The questions in her mind buzzed like busy bees.

meanings.definition: A matter requiring resolution or discussion.
meanings.sent1: The budget questions were discussed at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The team had important questions to address before the project.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the missing cookie sparked many questions.
meanings.sent4: The questions hanging in the air needed urgent attention.
meanings.sent5: The unanswered questions lingered like a shadow over the room.

meanings.definition: Doubt or uncertainty about a matter.
meanings.sent1: She had questions about the accuracy of the data.
meanings.sent2: His questions about the plan made him hesitant.
meanings.sent3: The questions in his mind created a cloud of doubt.
meanings.sent4: Her questions cast a shadow of uncertainty over the decision.
meanings.sent5: The questions whispered doubts in his ears.
